attributes.action: create laws that would allow children to secure their rights as defined in UN Convention on the Rights of the Child as ratified by the UK in 1992.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 1992 the UK ratified the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child. Since then the UK has not created a legal framework that allows children (and or their guardians) to exercise these rights.

The Convention gives children basic rights with respect to education, protection and health services. 

In particular, the incorporation into British law would ensure children have a legal channel to exercise their right to an education that "ensures the development of the child's personality, talents and mental and physical abilities to their fullest potential".
